discover.instruction: Read about a shopping trip. Notice what we can count and what we can't.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о походе в магазин. Обрати внимание, что можно посчитать, а что нельзя.

content.text: I went to the supermarket. I bought <highlight>three apples</highlight> and <highlight>two oranges</highlight>. I also got <highlight>some bread</highlight> and <highlight>some milk</highlight>. I needed <highlight>rice</highlight> for dinner. I picked up <highlight>a bottle of water</highlight> and <highlight>some cheese</highlight>. I got <highlight>five eggs</highlight> but I forgot to buy <highlight>butter</highlight>. I also bought <highlight>some coffee</highlight> and <highlight>a few biscuits</highlight>. My bag had <highlight>a lot of food</highlight> in it!
content.question: Why 'three apples' but 'some bread'? Why can't we say 'three breads'?
content.question_ru: Почему 'three apples', но 'some bread'? Почему нельзя сказать 'three breads'?

points.rule: Countable: can have a number, can be plural
points.rule_ru: Исчисляемые: можно использовать с числом, есть множественное число
points.example: one apple, two apples, three books, four cars

points.rule: Uncountable: no number, no plural, no a/an
points.rule_ru: Неисчисляемые: без числа, без множественного, без a/an
points.example: water (NOT: a water, two waters), rice, bread, money

points.rule: Common uncountable: food, liquids, materials, abstract
points.rule_ru: Частые неисчисляемые: еда, жидкости, материалы, абстрактные
points.example: rice, bread, milk, water, money, information, advice, music
a bottle of water, a piece of bread, a cup of coffee

notice.instruction: Identify each noun as countable (C) or uncountable (U).
notice.instruction_ru: Определи каждое существительное как исчисляемое (C) или неисчисляемое (U).

tasks.text: For breakfast, I usually have some coffee and toast. Sometimes I eat eggs with cheese. I need sugar in my coffee. My sister prefers tea with milk. She also eats fruit - usually an apple or a banana. On weekends, I make pancakes. I use flour, butter, and eggs. I love cooking! It's my favorite hobby.

find.reason: can count: one egg, two eggs

sentences.sentence: I need ___ information about the train.

sentences.correct: She gave me a lot of advice.
I bought two loaves of bread.
sentences.explanation: bread is uncountable, use a counter

produce.instruction: Write about what you eat and drink. Use countable and uncountable nouns correctly.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши о том, что ты ешь и пьёшь. Правильно используй исчисляемые и неисчисляемые существительные.
prompts: What do you have for breakfast?
What food do you buy at the supermarket?
Use: some, a/an, a piece of, a bottle of, etc.
produce.example: For breakfast, I usually have some toast and a cup of coffee. I sometimes eat two eggs with some cheese. I drink a lot of water during the day. At the supermarket, I buy some rice, a loaf of bread, and a bottle of milk. I also get some fruit - usually apples and bananas.

input_flood.description: Read 5 texts with countable and uncountable nouns.

texts.title: Shopping List
texts.content: I need to buy some things. I need a kilo of rice and some pasta. I want two bottles of water and some milk. I'll get some bread and a few eggs. I need cheese and butter too. Oh, and some fruit - maybe three apples and a bunch of bananas. I should get some coffee as well.

texts.title: At the Restaurant
texts.content: Waiter: What would you like? Customer: I'd like some soup to start. Then I'll have a steak with some rice. Waiter: Any drinks? Customer: A glass of water, please. And some wine with my meal. Waiter: For dessert? Customer: Some ice cream and a cup of coffee.

texts.title: Healthy Eating
texts.content: To be healthy, eat lots of fruit and vegetables. Have some fish twice a week. Drink plenty of water - at least eight glasses a day. Limit sugar and salt. Eat some nuts for snacks instead of biscuits. Have some rice or pasta with your meals. A little olive oil is good for you.

texts.title: Making a Cake
texts.content: To make a cake, you need some flour and some sugar. Add two eggs and some butter. Pour in some milk. Mix everything together. Add some chocolate chips if you like. Put the mixture in a pan. Bake for 30 minutes. When ready, add some icing on top. Enjoy a slice with some tea!

texts.title: Empty Fridge
texts.content: My fridge is almost empty! There isn't any milk. There's no bread either. I have some cheese, but not much. There are a few eggs - maybe three. There's some butter, but I need more. I have no fruit at all. I really need to go shopping. I need money too!

grammar_cards.front:
Find the error:
"I need an advice."
grammar_cards.back:
I need some advice.

advice is uncountable

common_errors: Using a/an with uncountable (a water, an advice)
Forgetting containers (two waters instead of two bottles of water)
